questions.text: Who was in a bad mood in the beginning of the episode?
questions.explanation:
Carla.

	Carla said she was in a bad mood because everything is going wrong. She said she was having a crisis of faith.

questions.text: What did Diane say is the oldest university in the world?
questions.explanation:
University of Bologna.

	The University of Bologna was founded in 1088. The university has about 100,000 students enrolled each year.

questions.text: Who did Coach say was the dean?
questions.explanation:
Oscar Mayer.

	Coach was making a joke, but only he laughed. Cliff said, "I hear sausage jokes are making a comeback."

questions.text: How long did Frasier want Diane to go to Europe with him?
questions.explanation:
6 months.

	Diane was hesitant to go.  She was afraid to leave Sam, that he might start drinking again.

questions.text: Why were they going to Europe?
options: Diane always wanted to go so he was surprising her.
questions.explanation:
Frasier was going to teach.

	Fraiser thought that Diane didn't want to go because she was still in love with Sam. Sam said Diane analyzes everything to death which is why she didn't react the way Fraiser wanted her too.

questions.text: Where did Sam say he and Diane traveled?
questions.explanation:
through Hell.

	Sam said that he and Diane didn't travel well together. She asked where they went and he said though Hell together. Diane said, "It helped that you spoke the language."

questions.text: What did Carla write in Italian for Diane?
questions.correct: Excuse me, Mr Pharmacist, where do you keep the peroxide?
options: Excuse me, Mr. Dentist, can you pull out my teeth?
Excuse me, Mr. Doctor, I think I'm dying.
Excuse me, Mr. Policeman, I lost my wallet.
questions.explanation:
Excuse me, Mr Pharmacist, where do you keep the peroxide?.

	Carla often made jokes about Diane's blonde hair being fake. The peroxide statement was just another cheap shot at her.

questions.text: Who took a long time saying goodbye to Diane?
questions.explanation:
Sam.

	Sam and Diane had been through a lot together. Despite their differences they had become good friends and in truth both still had romantic feelings for the other. They had a hard time saying goodbye for the "last" time.

Yes.

	They are in the process of saying goodbye to each other. They are reminiscing a little and in the course of saying goodbye they kiss.

questions.text: Who asked Diane to call if she could live with one day at a time?
questions.explanation:
Sam.

	She said Fraiser had promised her a future and couldn't give that up when Sam couldn't make a commitment. She left for Europe with Fraiser because she couldn't live one day at a time.
